title: A Tall Tale About Dachshunds in Costumes: How MORE Dogs Came to Be (Tall Tales Book 3)
features: A Tall Tale About Dachshunds in Costumes: How MORE Dogs Came to Be
A tall tale about dachshunds, who dress up one day, And want to stay dressed up forever that way!

Behold a dear friendship and dreams that come true. Some become other breeds, still their kindness shines through!A troupe of dachshunds plays dress-up in strewn-about vegetation after an autumn storm. Just like young children, they love their new costumes and don’t want to change.Through the power of love and magic, they stay in their costumes and overnight become other dog breeds. A playful story with informational glossaries for the dachshunds, the eight new dog breeds, and vegetation.

“This is a Tall Tale that keeps on giving! … This whimsical by-the-sea story also offers three delightfully illustrated glossaries … plus annotated drawings of Pacific Northwest seaside vegetation which play a major role in ‘the costumes’ chosen by each creative Dachshund.” — Sharon Fay Koch, writer; retired Board Certified Hospice Chaplain and former

staff writer“Kizzie Jones and Scott Ward have done it again! … It’s what’s on the inside that matters and makes us who we are in this world … As a psychologist and a mom, I believe this is such an important message to share with our children. This is truly a creative masterpiece …” — Kate Lund, Licensed Psychologist, Best Selling Author, and Mom“Come. Join this joyful dachshund pack as they turn a doggone day at the beach into an adventure to spread love one friend at a time. Dance with them through delightful verse and playful pictures because a dachshund by any other name is still so sweet.”— Wendy Kendall, Columnist, Kids are Bookin’ It,
“In her lyrical style, Kizzie … has woven whimsy and nature together to create a story of transformation, the magic of being one's true self.” —Peggy Sullivan, author of
Tevye the Magical Theater Cat, The Moon and Star,

“Having taught Kindergarten and lower grades for over thirty years, I find this book a wonderful teaching tool … Scott’s illustrations are great! Being a fan of storms, I especially love the girl and pups on the couch watching the raging tempest. I can hear the thunder!” — Leona Keith, Retired Early Childhood Educator“…Your book put a smile on my three-year-old grandson’s face! ….” — Paula Sobel, LCSW (Licensed Clinical Social Worker)“… no matter what you look like, no matter who you become, at the heart of this playful romp called life ‘is the love that resides in each creature’s heart.’ The illustrations wondrously match the message.” — Patrick Howell, S.J., Distinguished Professor in Residence at Seattle University

Also part of The Edmonds Writing Sisters anthology of prose and poetry covering our lives.', 'You’ll find me in my natural habitat, IRL (In Real Life), sharing what I love: dachshunds, children’s worlds, kindness in motion, telling my story. My greatest pleasures and proudest achievements are in the classroom and library readings I do with children, especially my annual bilingual School Reading Tour in Los Cabos, Mexico.', 'My Tall Tales are in bilingual Spanish editions and translation, as well as French and German. The third one, "Dachshunds in Costumes," also includes dog-and-vegetation-illustrated glossaries and there’s a coloring book for the second one.', 'My ultimate hero, Thom, and I love our three dachshunds, and our lives are full of the happiness they bring us.
